quote-source: Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 1938, Fireside Chat, the night before signing the Fair Labor Standards Act that instituted the federal minimum wage (via tsukinofaerii)
quote-text: Do not let any calamity-howling executive with an income of $1,000 a day, who has been turning his employees over to the Government relief rolls in order to preserve his companyâs undistributed reserves, tell you â using his stockholdersâ money to pay the postage for his personal opinions â tell you that a wage of $11.00 a week is going to have a disastrous effect on all American industry.
